name: Callirhoe
desc: Callirhoe, also known as Spring Fairy, is an Oceanid who left Fontaine after the previous Archon's death and settled in Springvale.

customize.name: Oceanids
customize.desc: Oceanids are intelligent Hydro lifeforms created by the previous Hydro Archon, Egeria, and are able to manipulate water at will. All the people of Fontaine were once Oceanids, whom Egeria had turned into humans to satisfy their wishes, going against the will of the Heavenly Principles.

customize.text: A race of intelligent Hydro beings to which Callirhoe belongs.

customize.name: Egeria
customize.desc: The previous Hydro Archon who died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.text: The previous Hydro Archon and Oceanids' creator.
Callirhoe's beloved, whom she met many years ago.

customize.name: Diona
customize.desc: A young lady who has inherited trace amounts of non-human blood. She is the incredibly popular bartender of the Cat's Tail tavern.

customize.text: Callirhoe blessed Diona to mix the perfect cocktails from any ingredients.

customize.name: Rhodeia
customize.desc: The most renowned and strongest of Lochfolk scouts. She fled Fontaine after the death of the previous Hydro Archon and settled in Qingce Village.

customize.name: Endora
customize.desc: Just a very curious Lochfolk who only wishes to see the world. Might actually get along very well with Mini Seelie: Dayflower, but please do not meld them together, thank you.

customize.name: Idyia
customize.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. She is an Oceanid and the caretaker of the "Bottleland," Veluriyam Mirage.

customize.name: Lyris
customize.desc: The Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage in Fontaine, she later became a member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and gained the title of "Red Empress" after the Institute was abandoned during the Cataclysm.

customize.text: During the reign of the previous Hydro Archon Egeria, the Oceanids were spies of the Archon who were sent into rivers and seas throughout Teyvat to unite everyone in the world, in much the same way as all water is connected. When Egeria died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago, and Focalors became the new Hydro Archon, the Oceanids did not accept her rule and left Fontaine. One of these Oceanids was Callirhoe, who found her home in the spring of Springvale in Mondstadt, receiving the name Spring Fairy. During her journey, the Oceanid spent all her strength, forgot about her former life and could no longer speak.

One day a boy came to the spring in tears, whom the fairy decided to console. This is how the friendship between the boy and the Oceanid began. He told her about all the events in his life, about the world and everything that was in his heart. When he cried from grief, she turned his tears into sweet water, which brought him pleasant dreams where he met the Oceanid. In these dreams, she told him about her homeland and her loneliness. Thanks to this friendship, Callirhoe learned to speak again.
Several years later, Callirhoe felt that the boy had feelings unknown to her. She was afraid of the separation, afraid that the boy would regret it at the end of his life, and ran away. She hoped that the boy would forget about her and live his own life, but every day he came to the spring and waited for her, doubting whether it was all real. Many years later he remained alone and could not comprehend the fairy's disappearance.
<color=#ffffffd9>"When the stars in the night sky have all gone out, and all streams and dreams have mingled in the same great ocean... Then, we will meet again."</color>

For many years, Callirhoe studied the feelings of people and the outside world, never forgetting about the boy. She was afraid to appear in front of him again and cause pain. But when the boy had already become an old man, the fairy finally overcame her fears and met her beloved, giving him her heart. Although she could not maintain her physical form for long, she promised that as long as her beloved had the Heart of Clear Springs, they would always be connected, no matter how far they would be from each other. At the end, she gave him a long-awaited kiss and merged with the spring water.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Egeria
customize.desc: The previous Hydro Archon who died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.text:
<color=#ffffffd9>Far from my native land I roamed,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>In streams I slept, many seasons I met as the suns set and rose.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I searched for a garden to call a home,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And the moonlight ebbed as the water flowed.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>A soft breeze beckoned me unto a spring</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Sleep, weary wanderer, your journey is over,"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"May the dancing petals sweeten your slumber."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>At dawn I hummed the melody of a distant stream,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And the songs in the night serenaded my dreams.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>A boy's tender tears trembled through the water,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Stirring me more than any starlight sonata.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Ho wove me a wreath from past petals and future buds,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I crossed beyond the veil of dreams to the realm of flash and blood.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Look at the love that shines from his eager gaze,"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Answer the call of his heart, lest this moment go to waste."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>The kittens and fireflies invited my heartstrings to sing,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>But I was a stranger to the melody of mankind, and knew not how this tune should begin.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>As the river of dreams trickled into the ocean blue,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Every time the crystalfly flapped its wings, older it seemed he grew.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>But I learned to fathom human ways each stumbling step I took,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And clouds of confusion became crystal clear, in the vulnerable verse I wrote.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>As seed yearns for soil, and trees for the sun,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>A once-foreign melody inside my heart sung,</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And it cried out your name in every string it could strum.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Now, I give my dream to you, may it be in your slumber a sweet spring to quench your thirst.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Now, I hand my heart to you, praying my belated promise might meet, still with your trust.</color>
Story Teaser: Heart of Clear Springs

<color=#ffd780>October 10, 2023</color>
Gazing upon flowing water, people are wont to lament the swift passage of time.
Yet in a village where spring waters come to a still, thoughts remain as clear as the reflection on a tranquil lake.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

desc.text:
The sky that night blossomed with flowers,
The stars that night hummed like bees,
In search of nectar and of dreams.
And we, that night, were as new as the dew,
Under moonlight flowing like silken honey,
Our words sweet as we sat by the spring.
But I turned and left you alone,
The poem in my heart left unspoken.
And since then,
The stars do not twinkle, the moon is ice-cold.
I hide them 'neath the water,
But your tears fall and find them.

The desire remains, but the time is past.
The boy by the spring grows frail too fast.
But when dreams flow to fruition, where streams join the sea,
We'll journey on in endless reverie.

imgDesc.text: Callirhoe and the Heart of Clear Springs.
